column2: bill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Bruce, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used Primatene Mist for 10 years for occasional asthma attacks.  It was always effective, although I used it infrequently because medical people gave me veiled warnings about it.  It is being withdrawn from the market in December 2011 because the CFC propellant interferes with the ozone layer and causes global warming.  I got a prescription to Albuterol sulfate inhalant.  Albuterol is not as strong as Primatene.  While Primatene takes effect in seconds, causing a brief cough and lingering feelings in the throat, Albuterol takes effect over 10 minutes and has no lingering throat feelings.  Both are effective long enough to get over my asthma attack, especially long enough for me to get a good night's sleep and feel refreshed in the morning.  I am pleased with Albuterol as a replacement for Primatene.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: As a Registered Respiratory Therapist, I am shocked beyond belief that WebMD would ever suggest using an OTC inhaler such as Primatene Mist for treating a condition as serious as asthma. If you are having problems breathing, or struggling with your asthma symptoms, you should contact your physician, got to the nearest er, or call 911. Primatene Mist is not something any qualified medical professional would ever recommend to treat or control asthma.

column2: TVIS, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i use to have bad asthma, so bad that a rescue inhaler would only last 2-3 weeks, when i got this product and started using it, i have NOT experienced a asthma attack in over 5 years like i use to. if i feel short of breath then one puff is enough, 1-2 puffs in the morning and i'm good all day. sometimes i do get the "racy" feeling when i use it.. most the time i don't. i recommend this as a backup and maybe if your up to it like me as a daily use..1 refill will last up to 6 months for me and i don't want to go back to the attacks and scary feeling from not knowing when ill have an attack or not being without my abut.

column2: Pattral, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used Primatine Mist inhalers for over 35 years and find it a very effective treatment for my asthma, I know it not prefered by doctors but it works for me and I feel it is a safe product that does not have the steriods in it like a lot of the prescription inhalers they have out.I do not have any bad side effects from it, I have tried the Primatine Mist pills and they do give me the shakes and make my heart race badly so I do not take them at all.  I have had doctors prescribe things like Advair. Combivent, Albuteral & Spireva when I go to them for an upper respirorty infection from time to time but all of these are very expensive and I do not ever feel the immidiate relief my Primatine Mist gives me.I was born with astma and after using it all these years my attacks do not come as ofen as they used to.

column9: My hands shake and my heart sometimes races when I use Primitene Mist, but not always. I try to only use one puff because my heart is more likely to race if I use two. Other than that, I've never had any side-effects.
